rename.from: SRT stream showing as black screen on listener.
rename.to: SRT stream not displaying on listener.

body:
We can't confirm your issue.
Two devs have checked independently that streaming from obs to an obs media source works fine.
Your logs suggest a network issue since the stream never connects.
It seems to be therefore a support issue rather than a genuine bug.
I'll close therefore this issue. Feel free to seek help in the support channels of our Discord server if you can't figure out what
was improperly configured on your side.
Thank you both for looking into it. Unfortunately no one in the Discord had an answer. I ended up rolling back to v30.0.2 and it's working again.
We're still investigating. Apparently this only occurs when you have "Use hardware decoding when available" enabled. Occurs in 30.1.0-beta1.

@brynlea could you retest but disable hardware acceleration in your Media Sources ? It should work. Check also if audio is reaching the Media Source.
From your sender log I incorrectly assumed you never connected. But if we're correct it's a decoding issue for video but not audio so you should get audio at least when hw decoding is enabled. But both video and audio if hw decoding is disabled
After turning off hardware acceleration the video does work, and audio works both ways.
Thanks for the confirmation. We haven't found a fix yet but the issue is related to our update of ffmpeg deps.

rename.from: SRT stream not displaying on listener.
rename.to: SRT stream not displaying on listener when using hardware decoding

issue.title: deps/media-playback: Fix hardware decoding of streams

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 30.1
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 30.1.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
Fixes #10369.
Since the update to FFmpeg 6.1, streams to a Media Source are broken if hardware decoding is enabled (both RTMP or SRT have been reported). The video is black although the audio is decoded fine. The manual copy of metadata introduced in commit [1] does not work any more for some unfathomable reasons.
As a fix we call instead the av_frame_copy_props function used in FFmpeg app in a similar context (hardware decoding) [2].
The metadata are copied without issues.
There is no need to guard the use of that function since it was introduced 9 years ago in avutil/frame.c.

[1] https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/commit/22fde5cdcd1c784cd60b8a8cd50af02e7e537182
[2] https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/master/fftools/ffmpeg_dec.c

NB: on FFmpeg master as of today (3/15/24), the relevant line I've copied is 
https://github.com/FFmpeg/FFmpeg/blame/master/fftools/ffmpeg_dec.c#L336

### Motivation and Context
Bugfix.

### How Has This Been Tested?
HW decoding works again with Media Source when one plays an RTMP stream.
HW decoding still works for local media files.

### Types of changes
- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) 

### Checklist:
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

body:
The issue is not related to SRT per se.
I reproduced it with RTMP.
I found a fix which is being reviewed.
The bug is due to the fact that several color codec params are not passed correctly.

rename.from: SRT stream not displaying on listener when using hardware decoding
rename.to: Remote media streams not displaying video when using hardware decoding in Media Source
